content: HomeBlogMarketingAffiliate MarketingThe Best Affiliate Marketing Tools in 2023 Marketing Intelligence The Best Affiliate Marketing Tools in 2023 Try Similarweb for free by Georgia Brisco 10 Min. May 11, 2023 X Facebook Linkedin Copy link Free Website Traffic Checker Discover your competitors' strengths and leverage them to achieve your own success Analyze Traffic Affiliate marketing is growing more impactful by the day. In fact, over the past five years, interest in it has increased by over 300%. And regardless of which side of the game you’re on (hey advertisers, managers, and publishers ), finding the best tool is crucial. Be it an all-in-one affiliate marketing tool or a purpose-specific software — there’s a lot out there. And a lot of lists will list… well, a lot. Below, you’ll find the best tools for affiliate marketing for managers or advertisers and publishers. (Note: some tools cover both sides, offering separate solutions depending on users’ needs. We’ve highlighted their leading service.) From keyword research tools for affiliate marketing, ad campaign monitoring, competitor tracking, or making your links shine — I’ve rounded up the crème de la crème of tools used by the pros, plus my affiliate platform of choice, below. (And if you’re newer around here, jump to our very mini affiliate marketing glossary below to brush up on what’s what in this wordy affiliate marketing world.) The Best Affiliate Marketing Tools (Free and Paid) Similarweb – best for identifying new affiliate partners and checking partner validity Post Affiliate Pro – best for monitoring affiliate performance data Similarweb extension – best free tool for affiliate vetting Voluum – best for affiliate ad tracking Pretty Links – best for link cloaking AffJet – best for monitoring affiliate network performance Bitly – best for free link shortening Linktrack – best for free, limitless link tracking CJ Affiliate – best for established publishers and brands to find partners and track performance Best affiliate marketing tools for managers and advertisers Affiliate managers manage online affiliate programs for advertisers. Affiliate advertisers sell their product or service through a publisher (also known as affiliates). Below are some of the best-in-class affiliate tool options for both. Similarweb Best for identifying and verifying affiliate partners In a nutshell Having to rely on self-reported affiliate data is no bueno. Similarweb is a great affiliate marketing tool that harnesses the most accurate data in the world — so you can see traffic numbers, engagement, and channel mix for any affiliate’s website and verify numbers. Because you’ll have the data to anticipate under-delivery in advance, you can dismiss affiliates that overpromise. You’ll also have clear data so you can negotiate partnership terms practically. The stands-outs Think of it as a digital truth serum of sorts that helps you check affiliate performances so you can ensure you’re working with the right ones. This accurate vetting makes affiliate recruitment smooth so you can create long-lasting, trustworthy relationships. Track the top keywords of your affiliate partners (or potential partners!) so you have a full picture of their content specialization. When you understand what core material they’re known for, you can confirm if they’re entirely aligned with your offering or if you need to do some pruning ‍. Easily find out which affiliates your competitors are partnered with and how successful those affiliates are at referring traffic to said competitors. Think granular detail: traffic distribution, engagement, traffic share over time, etc. This way, you can see affiliate publishers you might be missing out on. What are the pros of Similarweb? Delivers true website performance data so you can find the right affiliate partners fast Exceptional tracking: monitor your affiliates and potential affiliates all in one view One of the best spy tools for affiliate marketing Tailored price plan What are the cons of Similarweb? The affiliate software isn’t for one-person bands or very small companies (counter pro: it’s specifically designed for SMBs to Enterprise) No revenue tracking How much does Similarweb cost? Our plugin is free and our subscription is customized based on what you need. Post Affiliate Pro Best for creating and managing affiliate programs In a nutshell Post Affiliate Pro is a great affiliate software for advertisers to monitor and analyze affiliate performance data to increase sales. It’s also more accessible than many (whether you’re a start-up, SMB, or established enterprise). It’s especially great for tailored affiliate marketing plans or networks that make it easy for you to create and manage your own. The stand-outs The fully customizable commission structures are a huge plus. Incentivize affiliates to focus on driving high-quality traffic and conversions through action commissions. The Lifetime Commissions feature allows purchases from the same customer to always give commission to the same affiliate, even if the customer clicks on a different affiliate’s link. A variety of novel tracking methods deliver in-depth data you can use to increase sales. Track: impression or actions (see every action a customer takes, from where they came from or what they clicked on throughout your site) offline (via coupons), S2S (cookie-less), or pixel tracking. What are the pros of Post Affiliate Pro? Huge variety of tracking features Flexible interface optimization Tight fraud protection What are the cons of Post Affiliate Pro? Difficult to fully understand all features so learning time is needed Customer support can be slow How much does Post Affiliate Pro cost? Post Affiliate Pro offers a 14-day free trial Pro: $139/month or $129/month billed annually Ultimate: $269/month or $249/month billed annually Network: $649/month or $599/month billed annually Best free affiliate marketing tools for managers and advertisers Similarweb extension Best for on-the-go traffic checking of affiliates partners and competitors In a nutshell Our Similarweb extension makes it wildly easy to instantly see key data for any site you visit. (And, as always, this data is the most accurate in the world.) For affiliate marketing, this helps you scope out current and potential partners’ performances, as well as competitors’ traffic source details. The stand-outs Check any website’s traffic, channel mix, and engagement stats for potential affiliates See any website’s global ranking in its country and category What are the pros of the Similarweb extension? On-the-go website insights Totally free and simple to install Presentation of data is clear and easy to understand What are the cons of the Similarweb extension? Limited in granular data No mobile offering How much does the Similarweb extension cost? The Similarweb extension/plug-in is 100% free. Best affiliate marketing tools for publishers Affiliate publishers (also known as affiliates) are website owners or content creators who promote an advertiser’s product or service to their online audience in exchange for commissions. We’ve rounded up some of the best tools for publishers below! Voluum Best for affiliate campaign tracking In a nutshell Voluum is an all-in-one performance marketing tool that helps publishers and marketers track, measure, and optimize their digital campaigns across every channel. It offers a rare amount of control over how you want to monitor and optimize campaigns (it’s got your back, Type As ). The stand-outs Customizable tracking features, manual conversion upload (manage campaign data directly to ensure accuracy), landing page scanning, and hyper-fresh trend reports are some of my favorites. Track organic traffic, ad impressions, and measure all customer touchpoints throughout the conversion journey so you can improve it. Optimize paid traffic with precise targeting and fine-tuned campaign parameters (again, sweet ✨control✨ where it matters). It automatically sends your traffic to different landing pages/offers based on your rules, so you can create specifically enticing content for visitors and increase conversion rates. What are the pros of Voluum? Helpful customer support options and great how-to examples Track organic traffic and automate campaign optimization with “if/then” statements One of the few affiliate marketing tools that offers a mobile app What are the cons of Voluum? Limited features on the lower-priced plans Mobile app is missing a few of the important features How much does Voluum cost? Start-up: $499/month Agency: $999/month Enterprise: $1999/month Pretty Links Best for link cloaking In a nutshell If you use WordPress and are in affiliate marketing, do yourself a favor and add Pretty Links to your kit. It’s a simple, handy tool that offers more than just link-shortening glow-ups The stand-outs Its pièce de résistance is its link-cloaking automation. Turn long (and, let’s be honest, aesthetically irritating) links into shorter, more memorable ones. And its PrettyBar feature is worth mentioning: add a brandable bar to the top of any link to remind people of your brand and build affinity passively. It also centralizes link management, gives you granular unique click details (including IP addresses and referring sites), plus offers group-sorting and tracking options so you know how every one of your links is doing in real time. You can also set up multiple, advanced URL redirects (including traditional permanent and temporary redirects) to boost CTR. What are the pros of Pretty Links? Effortless link-sharing via automation Great-looking and easy-to-navigate dashboard What are the cons of Pretty Links? No option to schedule links No automatic link health checker How much does Pretty Links cost? Pretty Links offers a free WordPress plugin, as well as: Beginner: $99.50/year Marketer: $149.50/year Super Affiliate $199.50/year AffJet Best for monitoring affiliate network performance from one interface In a nutshell Affjet combines your affiliate marketing sales and commissions so you can see all earnings in one platform (its dashboard gives you stats from over 100 affiliate networks). This makes demoting poor-performing links and spotting otherwise missed opportunities a breeze. The stand-outs Adding your affiliate networks and importing all your data is quick and easy. (The amount of time saved by skipping logging into multiple networks is great ). Then you can filter data the way you want and see it right across your networks. Because of its centralized dashboard, tracking underperformers and bestsellers is seriously simple, so you can focus on maximizing ROI. Like Voluum, it’s one of the few tools with a mobile-friendly platform – check important report updates on the go. Affjet pros Consolidates affiliate earnings across different networks into one report Easy report-sharing Mobile-friendly so you can check reports on the go Affjet cons Customer service could be better How much does Affjet cost? Standard Plan: $5.79/month Medium Plan: $17.35/month Large Plan: $34.70/month: Custom Plan: Personalized Best free affiliate marketing tools for publishers Bitly Best for free URL shortening and link management In a nutshell Affiliate links can be long and clunky. You want neat. Bitly’s a popular URL-shortening software and one of the best free affiliate marketing tools. It converts the cumbersome into the chic, creating more visually easy links to increase CTR. The stand-outs Bitly’s freemium version includes customizable link-in-bios, an easy-to-read, flexi way to arrange and share your most important affiliate links. You’ll also have access to the performance data for your link-in-bio. The option to download a QR code for any one of your links. What are the pros of Bitly? Easy-to-use web browser extension makes shortening links quickly a breeze Shorten links directly from your mobile with the iOS or Android app What are the cons of Bitly? The free version only offers 10 short links/month (these include QR codes and link-in-bio) Custom-branded links are only available on a paid plan No direct customer support for freemium users How much does Bitly cost? Bitly’s freemium version is entirely free. It also offers paid subscription options depending on what you need. Linktrack Best for free link tracking In a nutshell LinkTrack is a marketing tool that lets you track your affiliate links for free (via its freemium offering), so you can see how they’re performing and discern which sources are generating most affiliate traffic. All created links live in one place on your account, too! The stand-outs Track a limitless number of links (ad tracking, click tracking, and impression tracking) so you can see which are working well vs. which need reassessing. Keep a check on commissions and see your link conversions at a glance through graphical monitoring (a rare feature to find without a subscription fee ). Get real-time updates on your link performance via Linktrack’s website or through its API. What are the pros of Linktrack? Linktrack’s freemium service offers detailed tracking data for free Straightforward and easy to set up What are the cons of Linktrack? Unique visitor tracking is only available on a paid plan Links created using the free subscription expire after seven days/100 clicks Custom or vanity URLs are only available on a paid plan How much does the Linktrack cost? Linktrack’s freemium version is entirely free. Otherwise, it offers paid subscription options depending on what you need. Best affiliate marketing platform CJ Affiliate (formerly Commission Junction) Best for established publishers and brands to find partners and track performance In a nutshell CJ Affiliate is an affiliate marketing network that connects publishers and brands. CJ’s been around for over 20 years — and with over 3,000 brands on its books, you can tell. Think big dogs, from Barnes & Noble to GoPro. Best suited for established publishers, CJ specializes in pay-for-performance. It makes it simple to discover and nurture quality partnerships. The stand-outs Great filter options across the tool. For instance: tailor partner results based on potential earnings (network, 7-day or 3-month EPC), or filter products based on category, promotion types, link types, etc. CJ’s a great platform when it comes to real-time reporting. Up-to-the-minute analytics help you monitor your affiliate partnerships activity as it happens. Keep a finger on the pulse without… lifting a finger? If you’re seasoned in affiliate marketing, you know the drill (and it can be as annoying as a real-life one ): most display advertising networks bunch up handfuls of products in one ad code. With CJ, you choose exactly which products you want to showcase and where. Done the work and have a platform smashing it? Enter: CJ’s Content Certification program. Designed to make it easy for content-focused publishers to connect with over 600 advertisers automatically, it gives you the power to increase affiliate revenue without the legwork. More time for stellar content creation . What are the pros of CJ Affiliate? Trusted fraud protection software Fast, human customer support What are the cons of CJ Affiliate? Limited to physical products Advertisers are known to be picky (if you haven’t generated any sales on CJ, chances of being accepted are low) Limited payment options available (no PayPal) How much does CJ cost? Customized subscription based on what you need. Affiliate marketing: a mini glossary You’re not in affiliate marketing unless you’re seeing 3+ terms for the same thing. Here’s a quick refresh/101: Advertisers Also known as merchants, brands, retailers. Basically, whoever’s selling the product or service being promoted and sold through the affiliate. Networks Also known as affiliate networks or affiliate intermediaries. An affiliate network is a platform that acts as the intermediary between publishers (affiliates) and advertisers. Advertisers establish affiliate programs on an affiliate network, while publishers register with and search the network for programs they want to promote. The affiliate network manages both publishers and advertisers. Publishers Also known as affiliates, affiliate marketers, or associates. OR sometimes just referred to directly: websites, influencers, content creators, bloggers. Publishers promote an advertiser’s products or services on their platforms (website, social media, etc.) in exchange for sales commissions. Affiliate managers The people responsible for managing online affiliate programs for advertisers. Why affiliate marketing is important for advertisers and content creators There’s a reason affiliate marketing is growing exponentially: it comes with less risks and (if you put in the work and think smart) high rewards. It’s also easy to set up and a generally cool way to connect with creators/publishers or brands in your industry The top affiliate marketing tools will help you with this. If you’re an advertiser, it’s a way to increase competitive advantage, build solid brand recognition and association, and increase traffic and ROI. And if you’re on the other side of things, as a content creator, affiliate marketing enables you to ensure your content is infused with profit-generating partnerships. Not only that, but working on your affiliate marketing strategy will see you naturally learning more about what your audience wants and doesn’t want – and you’ll likely capture brand-new followers alongside your incoming affiliate commissions, too. As an affiliate advertiser or manager, accurately pinpointing and vetting affiliates for your brand (based on their industry relevance, traffic share, and audience engagement) is key. As is being able to analyze which affiliates are sending traffic to competitors so you can consider fostering partnerships with them. With Similarweb, you can do both with precision and speed, introducing your product or service to the right people and boosting sales.
